Analysis of voting records: The expert likely examined the voting records of both individuals to determine if they consistently aligned on key issues or if there were significant differences in their voting patterns.
Evaluation of public statements: The expert likely analyzed the public statements made by both individuals to see if they expressed similar views or if there were notable differences in their ideologies and priorities.
Examination of common causes and priorit: The expert likely looked into the issues and causes that both individuals have championed to see if there were any significant overlaps or if their priorities diverged significantly.
Assessment of styles and backgrounds: The expert may have considered the personal styles and backgrounds of both individuals to assess if they share similar approaches to governance or if they have distinct approaches and experiences that would make it unlikely for them to be ideologically aligned.
